A Song of degrees. When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.<RF>turned…: Heb. returned the returning<Rf>
Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The LORD hath done great things for them.<RF>hath…: Heb. hath magnified to do with them<Rf>
The LORD hath done great things for us; <FI>whereof<Fi> we are glad.<CM>
Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the south.
They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.<RF>joy: or, singing<Rf>
He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves <FI>with him<Fi>.<RF>precious…: or, seed basket<Rf><CM>
